name: global_temperature_trend
title: How close are we to reaching a global warming of 1.5˚C?

content.markdown:
Reaching 1.5˚C of global warming - a limit agreed under the Paris agreement - may feel like a very distant reality, but it might be closer than you think. Experts suggest it is likely to happen between 2030 and the early 2050s. See where we are now and how soon we would reach the limit if the warming continued at today’s pace. Use the slider to explore how the estimate changes in time.

Explore the app in the CDS

meta_description: This application monitors the evolution of the global surface air temperature over recent decades until the present and estimates, using a 30-year linear trend, the level of global warming at the date up to which the trend is calculated, and the date when global warming will reach the 1.5°C limit of the Paris agreement.
